original: Ödlund, Eva Maria, fröken, Linköping, f. 5/11/92 i Njurunda, Väster-norrl. 1., av landsfiskal O. P. Ö. o. Hilma Schöblom. — Härnösands flick-sk., vävläriex. v. Handarb. vänner i Sthlm 11, handarb :lär:ex. v. Handarb. vänn. o. Hulda Lundins h. slöjd-sem. i Sthlm 15. Komm^koll. stip. f. textilstud. i Eng], o. Frankr. 21, Sv. slöjdfören. stip. f. textilstud. i Tyskl., Tjeckoslov., Ital. 29, stift. Lars Hier-tas minn. stip. f. stud. i Belgien, Tyskl., Danm. 35, res. i Norge, Finl. Anst. s. led:na av väv- o. sömn :kurser i Bohuslän h. Gbgs o. Boh. 1. slöjdnd 14-17, direktris f. östergötl. 1. hemsl :fören. fr. 1(7. Ordf. i Linköp. husmrfören. 42-46, ordf. f. Östergötl. husm:förb., led. av centrrstyr. f. Sv:es husm:-fören. riksforb., styriled. i Sv. hem-slöjdifören. riksförb., i Hem’slöjdsförb., ordf. i Hemslöjdsringen. Skr.: Vävbok (38). Sv. hemsl ifören. riksförb. silverplak. 42, FMM f. hum. verks.
translated: Ödlund, Eva Maria, Miss, from Linköping, born on November 5, 1892 in Njurunda, northern Western. 1., daughter of district fiscal O. P. Ö. and Hilma Schöblom. — Härnösands girls' school, weaving diploma from the Handicraft Friends in Stockholm in 1911, handicraft teacher diploma from Handicraft Friends and Hulda Lundin's domestic craft seminar in Stockholm in 1915. Received scholarship from the Commercial College for textile studies in England and France in 1921, Swedish Handicraft Society scholarship for textile studies in Germany, Czechoslovakia, and Italy in 1929, Lars Hiertas memorial scholarship for studies in Belgium, Germany, and Denmark in 1935, and traveled to Norway and Finland for work. Employed as a leader of weaving and sewing courses in Bohuslän near Gothenburg and Bohuslän's Handicraft Association from 1914 to 1917, director of Östergötland's domestic craft association from 1942 to 1946, chairman of Östergötland's domestic craft federation, board member of the central board for the Swedish domestic craft federation, board member of the Swedish domestic craft association, chairman of the domestic craft ring. Written works: "Vävbok" (1938). Received the silver plaque from the Swedish domestic craft federation in 1942, recipient of the FMM for humanitarian work.

structured.name: Eva Maria Ödlund
structured.description: Miss Eva Maria Ödlund was born on November 5, 1892 in Njurunda, Sweden. She was the daughter of district fiscal O. P. Ö. and Hilma Schöblom.
